Mike Pence shuts 1 door, leaves another open U.S. Rep. Mike Pence shut the door Thursday on seeking the presidency in 2012 but left unanswered whether his choice instead is the Indiana governor's office. I'm open to running for governor, Mike Pence said in an exclusive interview with The Indianapolis Star. "We're going to take the next several months to travel across the state and hear what Hoosiers have to say. We'll seriously consider it.

A city hall spokeswoman said: Leo Boland has spearheaded an extremely successful reorganisation of the GLA, implementing significant structural and cultural change to create an efficient and professional organisation. From this position of strength- and in light of proposals in the Localism bill for directly-elected mayors to combine chief executive functions- Mr Boland questioned whether the GLA now requires a high calibre, highly paid chief executive role in addition to a Ken Livingstone . On that basis, he recommended an independent review be carried out to look at this issue.
